title: Meet the Mass. musicians who swept the 2025 New England Music Awards
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Entertainment The 2025 New England Music Awards ceremony took place on Nov.
16 in Foxborough.
The Far Out performing at The Sinclair in Cambridge.

title: Gov. candidate backs away from GOP label
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Mike Minogue, a businessman, is running for governor as a Republican while portraying himself as an independent voice.
Mike Minogue.

title: Livestream: Day 2 of Brian Walshe’s murder trial
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Prosecutors will continue to present their case on Tuesday.
Livestream via NBC10 Boston.
Witness testimony will continue on Tuesday in the Brian Walshe murder trial, as prosecutors work to build their case in Norfolk Superior Court.

title: Hunting season is here in Mass. Be careful if you walk or bike in these areas.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The state recommends non-hunters wear a blaze orange hat or vest and know when and where hunting is permitted.
An Ashfield resident watches turkey decoys from a blind 20 yards away.
Stan Grossfeld/The Boston Globe Shotgun deer hunting season season has begun in Massachusetts.

title: Giants kicker Younghoe Koo had a field goal attempt go hilariously wrong at Gillette Stadium
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The play ended up being scored as a run rather than a field goal attempt.
New York Giants place kicker Younghoe Koo arrives at Gillette Stadium ahead of the game against the Patriots on Dec.

title: As the MVP hype grows, Drake Maye is ‘realizing what he can be’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots quarterback is developing into one of the NFL's best and the Gillette Stadium crowd let him hear it Monday night.
Drake Maye after the Patriots' win over the Giants.

Barry Chin/Globe Staff FOXBOROUGH – The moment that sparked MVP chants for Drake Maye during New England’s Monday night mauling of the Giants was a beautifully-placed deep ball to Kyle Williams that went for a 33-yard touchdown.

title: After a U.S. tour and opening for Noah Kahan, Cambridge’s Lily Fitts is in search of truth
author: Gwen Egan
bullets: Entertainment The Topsfield-born singer-songwriter had a sold-out homecoming show at the Sinclair last month, and is now touring in Europe.
By Gwen Egan December 2, 2025 | 6:43 AM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Lily Fitts, a 24-year-old Americana singer and songwriter originally from Topsfield, Massachusetts, is about as New England as you can get.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in dominant win over Giants
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Marcus Jones set the tone, Christian Elliss made big hits, and the Patriots won their 10th game in a row.

Marcus Jones and Christian Gonzalez celebrate a big play AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH – The Patriots put together a dominant performance against the Giants on Monday night, stacking their tenth straight victory.
Marcus Jones gave New England an early double-digit lead with an electric punt return and New England never looked back, burying New York before halftime.

title: Markey calls Pete Hegseth a ‘war criminal,’ joining bipartisan reproach after report that U.S. forces killed boat strike survivors in Caribbean
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Hegseth reportedly gave an order to "kill everybody" on an alleged drug vessel, leading to a potentially illegal second strike to kill survivors.
Senator Ed Markey spoke during a press conference in August.
Lane Turner/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: ‘Completely inadequate and inhumane’: Rep. Seth Moulton returns to ICE field office in Burlington
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “Candidly, there's no excuse that they have no sleeping mats from June until now,” Moulton said.
Rep.
Seth Moulton speaks to reporters outside of the ICE field office in Burlington Monday after he toured the facility.
